text:
Could you help me with an unexpected result in a DataFrame?

I'm trying to extract some information from a gzip CSV file and I found out a way to extract the values this way:

```a_copy = load(File(format"CSV", file), delim=';') |> DataFrame

a_cols = select(a_copy, :descritivo_item, :valor_total) # 592473x2 DataFrame

filtered_copy = a_cols[ismissing.(a_cols[!, :descritivo_item]), :] # 0x2 DataFrame```
However, I'm struggling to understand why the DataFrame returned with cells that has no value instead of missing (see the screenshot)

Any ideas of what I may be doing wrong here?

elements.text:
Could you help me with an unexpected result in a DataFrame?

I'm trying to extract some information from a gzip CSV file and I found out a way to extract the values this way:

a_copy = load(File(format"CSV", file), delim=';') |> DataFrame

a_cols = select(a_copy, :descritivo_item, :valor_total) # 592473x2 DataFrame

filtered_copy = a_cols[ismissing.(a_cols[!, :descritivo_item]), :] # 0x2 DataFrame

However, I'm struggling to understand why the DataFrame returned with cells that has no value instead of missing (see the screenshot)

Any ideas of what I may be doing wrong here?

text: probably the strings in that columns are not `missing` but empty (i.e. `""`), therefore you can write `isempty` instead of `ismissing` in your code, or write e.g. `filter(:descritivo_item => isempty, a_cols)`

elements.text: probably the strings in that columns are not
in your code, or write e.g.

text: Wow, quite obvious and I didn't notice it! Now it works. Thanks for the help, <@U8JAMQGQY>! :juliaheartpulsing:
